data.name: Brackets can be made valid?
data.description:
You must determine if a given expression's bracketing can be made valid by flipping them in-place.

An expression has a valid bracketing when all the parentheses (), square brackets [], curly braces {} are correctly paired and nested.
You can flip a bracketing element in-place by replacing it with its counterpart.

There can be brackets in strings and you have to ignore them. That means, ignore everything that is in quotes "ignore (this)".

Valid example:
```
const sum = )a,b( => }return a + b{ → const sum = (a,b) => {return a+b}

})[(}{(]){ → {([({})])}

const hello = () => word!"}()[]]]{{]]][)" → const hello = () => word!
```

Invalid example:
```
const sum = {a,b) => [return a+b)

{({)(()}{[[}]

const hello(")" => word!"}()[]]]{{]]][)" → const hello( => word!
```

Test: 10000 test cases with strings of 500 maximum length
